name: Movie Listings Quiz | Name the Movie | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Renée Zellweger as a diet-obsessed woman looks for suitable husband material."
questions.explanation:
Bridget Jones's Diary.

	This 2001 comedy/romance also starred Hugh Grant and Colin Firth.

questions.text: "Teenage daughters complicate two women's friendship." Starring Lana Turner.
questions.explanation:
Imitation of Life.

	This 1959 drama was a remake of the 1934 movie of the same name which starred Claudette Colbert.

questions.text: "New college graduates try to find their niche in the world." Starring Rob Lowe.
questions.explanation:
St. Elmo's Fire

	This 1985 drama also starred Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy and Ally Sheedy among others.

questions.text: "Elijah Wood stars as a boy who embarks on a transworld quest for new parents."
questions.explanation:
North.

	This 1994 comedy was directed by Rob Reiner. Co-starring as North's parents were Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Jason Alexander of "Seinfeld".

questions.text: "A baseball groupie gives pointers to a brash young pitcher." Starring Kevin Costner.
questions.explanation:
Bull Durham.

	This 1988 comedy co-starred Susan Sarandon as Annie the team's "mascot". Also co-starring Ms. Sarandon's real life love interest Tim Robbins.

questions.text: "Maxwell Caulfield stars as a British exchange student who falls for a female gang leader."
questions.explanation:
Grease 2.

	This 1982 sequel to "Grease" also co-starred Michelle Pfeiffer as Stephanie Zinone, the tough gang leader of the Pink Ladies.

questions.text: "A rookie cop is partnered with a corrupt cop played by Denzel Washington."
questions.explanation:
Training Day.

	This 2001 crime/thriller also co-starred Ethan Hawke as Jake Hoyt, the rookie cop paired up with Alonzo Harris (Denzel Washington).

questions.text: "Whoopi Goldberg stars as a basketball fanatic who is hired to coach the New York Knicks."
questions.explanation:
Eddie.

	This 1996 comedy starred Whoopi Goldberg as Edwina "Eddie" Franklin as a limo driver who is hired by the new owner of the Knicks (Frank Langella).

questions.text: "An aristocrat falls in love with her father's stable boy played by Laurence Olivier."
questions.explanation:
Wuthering Heights.

	This 1939 drama was directed by William Wyler and co-starred Merle Oberon as Catherine Earnshaw.  Adapted from the novel of the same name written by Emily Brontë.

questions.text: "Mel Brooks' parody of a famous Transylvanian bloodsucker played by Leslie Neilsen."
questions.explanation:
Dracula: Dead and Loving It.

	This 1995 comedy co-starred Peter MacNicol as Count Dracula's trusty servant Renfield.  Also appearing in this movie are Dom Deluise, Charlie Callas and Anne Bancroft.
